title: SoC GEN_CMN 110-0-21 Voice for Performance

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The focus of this class is on the development of vocal technique for the performer through work on relaxation, body alignment, breathing, vocal placement, resonance and exploration of the sounds of English using the IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet). Individual vocal problems are analyzed and remedial work prescribed. As vocal skills develop the focus will include connecting the speaking voice to the sounds of English and their relationship to meaning through the use of poetry and selected text. Final will consists on bringing all the elements covered in the class together for a group performance of selected poetry performed on the stage.
